title: Siddhartha
occurrences: You will grow tired, Siddhartha. Will I grow tired?
Siddhartha shall do what his father says.
You, Siddhartha, will become a great sadhu because you've learned everything so quickly.
I don't know why you speak like this, Siddhartha. Because you're not a farmer
Siddhartha! I've been accepted.
Siddhartha!
But He has given me Siddhartha, He has given me myself.
Three years ago I was Siddhartha, the Brahmin's son who left his home
You are lucky, Siddhartha.
You must never leave me, Siddhartha.
If you think that I, Siddhartha, will do you any harm, then say good-bye and I'll leave.
Not everyone is clever, Siddhartha.
My name is Siddhartha. I was a sadhu when you last saw me.
Well, you're welcome, Siddhartha. My name is Vasudeva.
You know, Siddhartha? I had a wife once.
Siddhartha, this river is everywhere, everywhere at the same time.
Siddhartha...
Siddhartha... Umh..
...your eyes are like his, Siddhartha.
You have not slept, Siddhartha. No, Vasudeva.
You have suffered, Siddhartha. But I see that sadness has not entered your heart.
Siddhartha...
Vasudeva... Siddhartha...
Siddhartha, we have traveled a long way on this river.
Siddhartha! Govinda.
Tell me something I can understand. Help me, Siddhartha.
